section.name: Community Roles
section.p: We are not very strict in the roles at this community, and you can basically assign any role to yourself, with a few exceptions mentioned below. Below is a list of the formal roles, informal roles and 'teams' that we consider this community to consist of.

subsection.name: User
subsection.p: The most important role in our community is the User. The people who actually use the products that we produce. If the user have a question, it should be attended to as soon as possible. A happy user is the best advertising and free of charge. A non-happy user can spoil our reputation.

subsection.name: Developer
subsection.p: The Developer is the backbone of the community. To become a Devloper, you only need to register yourself and jump in. You are required to subscribe to the dev-dpml@lists.ibiblio.org mailing list, and you should also add your bio into the People list, preferably with photo. You also need to familiarize yourself with the total Process, especially the Coding Standard.

subsection.name: Documentation Team
subsection.p: The Documentation Team is the heroes of any Open Software community, but they are hard to find. Developers will support any documentation effort to the best of their abilities, so if you have a desire to write, but doesn't know all the details required, please still take on the challenge and ask around for the details.

subsection.name: Infrastructure Team
subsection.p: The Infrastructure Team is responsible for the DPML infrastructure, i.e. the configuration, maintenance and operations of servers and applications on those servers. The process of selecting the Infrastructure Team is not yet determined, as we will need some constraint on who have root access on these critical resources. However, most applications should be configured to be configurable through Subversion and operated through web interfaces, and therefor allow all developers to help out.

subsection.name: Public Relations Team
subsection.p: You can assign yourself to the Public Relations Team, simply by subscribing to the pr-dev@lists.ibiblio.org mailing list and announcing that you want to help out.

subsection.name: Quality Assurance Team
subsection.p: This is a formal team, which is selected by the developers. Only people with a strong sense of quality assurance should opt for this position. Only the QA Team has access to the QA step on the code ladder, and high level of scrutiny should be done for every commit in QA. If in doubt or disagreement, the release process is aborted, and starts over in Main.

subsection.name: Release Manager
subsection.p: This is a formal role, and it is assigned by the QA Team. The Release Manager is responsible for the entire QA process and that the Production step in the code ladder is in perfect shape. Therefor, only the Release Manager(s) has commit access to Production
